column1: swinging into the pads, and flicked airily into the leg side, finds the gap, and that's an all-run four to launch the new Perth Stadium's history... which is an indication of the length of these boundaries!
outside off, and that's a tentative dangle as the ball curled back in at good pace. Just beat the edge
half forward, met on the front foot with a firm push to mid-off
wider line, good carry, no stroke this time
squared up on the back foot, poked to mid-on as Roy watches the swing onto the middle of his bat
that is an absolute nut. Tight line, good pace, bit of nibble as the ball bursts past Bairstow's non-committal push. Threatening
bashed, in the air, past point! Roy was reaching for that one, a big outswinger, very similar to his dismissal at Adelaide, but this time he finds the gap and the boundary
loose drive, beats the edge as Hazlewood finds more swing from a good length
blocked down to third man, a controlled edge to keep the scoreboard ticking
left alone on a good length outside off, excellent pace and bounce, gathered at head height by Paine
beats the edge once more, wider line, and Bairstow keeps his bat inside the line, just
wider line, no stroke offered
tight line from over the wicket, blocked back down the pitch on the front foot
back of a length, punched on the up into the covers
outside off, nibble off the seam as the ball bursts past the edge again. Roy is playing with circumspection so far, have England been chastised by their calamity in Adelaide?
short, and hauled through the leg side! So quick to capitalise on bowler error, that sat up and begged
wallop! Roy plants the front foot, as if pre-meditating the fuller length after Starc's error the previous ball. Flings the bat through the line and all the way over long-off!
and that is the end of that! Outside off, Roy is caught on the crease, takes the edge, a fine diving catch from Paine behind the stumps, in front of first slip but hang on ... it's a no-ball!
a free hit and a free swing of the bat, but no contact through to the keeper
outside off, nudged down through third man to get Bairstow off the mark
a bouncing bomb of a delivery! Outside off, swinging away, and exploding off the seam and over Paine's gloves! That's WACA-worthy carry!
less dramatic carry this time as Roy leaves alone
lift off the deck, over the top of the stumps. I said I'd reserve judgement on this new ground until I'd seen the pitch. I rather like the look of it so far...
onto the front foot, compactly stabbed through mid-off, where Warner fails to intercept. That races to the rope
flogged! Much more power and intent this time, a full-blooded fling of the hands, into the line of the ball and away through the covers. Roy is ticking
angled bat, down into the ground, through third man
wider line, angled across the right-hander, no stroke offered
battered through the line, hit on the up, very Graham Gooch in outlook, if I may say so. Clean through mid-on
crunched on the up, out to cover
on the pads, flicked out through midwicket, and timed to perfection. Roy is racing!
full length, looked like a slower ball, tapped to mid-on to steal a single, and the strike. Poor old Jonny is just a spectator at present
defended down into the crease, Bairstow is alert and jogs through for the single
pushed into the covers
big stride, left alone outside off stump
banged in short but down the leg side, we'll have that one again
blocked into the off side, on a good length
fipped off the toes, no real timing but as previously mentioned, this outfield is a belter. Two men give chase, but they can't haul it in
under-edged drive, past the leg stump and that's four more through fine leg. Bairstow is up and away with a bit of good fortune
tight line, Roy walks inside the line but can't deflect it fine enough to beat the field
onto the front foot, pushed back to the bowler
nibble off the seam, and deflected through to the cordon
leaning forward and defended back down the pitch
back of a length, nudged off the full face of the bat into the leg side
inswing, and struck on the pad... there's an appeal, not especially vociferous it has to be said, and Smith declines the review after a brief consultation
blocked into the leg side, another quick single
that's a good leave, or a brave one. Grazes past the stumps with the angle bringing the ball back into the right hander
cracked into the covers
width, and a gliding back-cut down to third man
worked into the leg side
absolutely nailed straight back down the pitch, but too straight. Splatters the stumps and takes the pace off the ball
drilled hard and straight, just to the side of the stumps this time, and England keep on cooking
pushed into the leg side, looking to get onto the front foot at all times
full length, attacking the stumps, defended into the covers
rising delivery, outside off stump, dabbed down through third man
flicked off the toes, out to midwicket
nip off the seam, climbing into the thigh pad. Some encouragement for the bowler
nip off the seam, and Paine is convinced there's a noise! Tye doesn't appeal, and Smith backs his bowler ... with good reason it seems from the replay
full length, attacking the toes, tapped into the off side
squeezed into the covers, watchful against the full length
nurdled down to third man with an open face
full once more, squeezed into the off side
stabbed down into the crease and Bairstow reacts sharply to kick the ball away! That was threatening to roll back into the timbers, but crisis averted
on the toes, tickled to midwicket
stretching onto the front foot to defend
a flashy drive, stretching onto the front foot and bashing through the line to mid-off
stabbed defence on the front foot once more
back and across, whipped into the leg side, and Bairstow gallops back for a non-existent second. He's brisk!
striding onto the front foot, and punched to cover
worked into the off side
ripping delivery, and there's a clear snick as the ball bounces through to the keeper! But no appeal at all, curious. Seemed to miss everything...

battered high in the air, and Hazlewood circles at mid-on to gather a steepling miscue! The knuckleball does the trick, Roy was deceived by the change of pace, was through his shot too soon, and an aggressive if at times streaky innings comes to an end
tip and run and a single into the covers
solid defence outside off stump
nudged down to third man, Hales is up and running
pushed to leg
a big appeal but a touch too leg-sided to justify a decision
poked back down the pitch, a touch of drift through the air to help the deception in flight
nurdled out to the leg side
back of a length but skidding through, Bairstow dances at the crease but can't find the gap
chopped through third man and they scamper back for the second
jabbed into the leg side
yorker, well directed, well dug out
clipped on the up and out through midwicket
checked drive, that is sweetly timed! Clean through mid-on, and that races to the rope
punched through the line once more, to mid-on
sweetly timed into the covers, picking the slower ball and guiding it into the gap
worked off the pads to the leg side
banged in short, and flashed up and into the covers
a leg-sided long-hop, but he gets away with the drag-down, a yawning pull out to midwicket
blocked into the covers
swept out through the leg side
swept again and this time he nails it, into the gap behind square
tight line, steered into the covers
fuller length, tight to off stump again, solid defence
short and swiped out through the leg side
forward, punched to mid-off
nailed through the covers! Bairstow stretches onto the front foot, presents the full face, and fillets the two fielders to race to the rope
banged in short, no stroke offered
round the wicket, lobbed up and tapped towards mid-on
tossed up on the stumps, Hales waits and works one through square leg
dances in and pushes a flat delivery on off, YJB prods it back to the bowler
oof, watch out by the sight screen! Boshed straight down the ground by Bairstow, leaping out to cream the ball for six - and that's the England 100 up, lickety-split
darted in and nudged away square for one
tossed up on the stumps, tapped back
over the wicket, hits a length around off, YJB pushes back down the track
good length, 138kph and punched on the up towards extra cover
angled across and Bairstow picks out a fielder in the covers again
full outside off, 140kph and clipped towards mid-off
short ball, 145kph/90mph... and helped on it's way over the third man boundary! Bit of a wafty uppercut, Zampa was down there but never in the game
rapped on the pads, there's a shout for lbw - but Smith indicates it was maybe high and they don't review
flighted, comes across on off and taps to cover
dobbed on the stumps, tucked into the leg side
darted on off stump, pushed into the off side again
touch short and Hales swats it through point, into a gap and they trundle back for a second
fired in and pushed away to the off side
makes a bit of room and whacks the ball through mid-off, gets it away for four - and England continue to motor at sixes, despite a tight over

bowled 'im, YJB deflects the ball on to his stumps! Starc makes the breakthrough, pace and zip off the pitch and Bairstow prodded with a wonky bat, trying to run it behind point but only getting an inside edge on to leg stump
full length, angled across at 145kph and Root has a flirt with it, a loose push to his first ball but he fortunately fails to connect
straighter line, slung down full and blocked to leg
pitched up outside off, Root eases a drive away through the covers
back of a length, Hales takes it on the body trying to play across the line
in the channel, rising sharply at 139kph and this one is left alone
tossed up on middle and leg and nurdled through midwicket
over the wicket to Hales, who drops back and slaps a cut to backward point
pushed in towards middle and off stump, clipped down the ground
drops a touch short and Root seizes on it, whirling a pull through midwicket
FORE! Here comes Hales, more of a pitching wedge but it sails high and long down the ground into the vacant seats by the sightscreen
prodded back to the bowler

slightly full on the pads, swinging in as Root flicks across the line and sends the ball racing away into the vacant green acres - though we might get another all-run four there, but Root slipped slightly coming back for the third
drops short, Hales opens the shoulders and carves the ball square, Maxwell does well to get fingertips on it to keep them to one
rising off a length, 139kph/87mph and pushed into the covers
full and driven, Starc gets a fingertip on it in his follow through but can't quite divert it on to the stumps at the non-striker's end
short ball, sits up like a nail to be hammered and Hales obliges, gets a couple in front of deep midwicket
fires in the yorker to finish, gets the bat down on it in time
strays on to the pads and Root skims his first boundary, leaves Hazlewood on his hands and knees at fine leg
good length, blocked on off stump
full, tailing in and nudged through midwicket for one
length ball around fourth stump, 130kph and dabbed down square
fuller, no width for Hales who defends towards cover
comes across and blocks into the covers once more - solid over from Marsh
lobbed up outside off and steered through the covers
dragged short and leg side but Hales misses out with a pull, hit on the knee roll
floated up and drilled into the covers, where Steven Smith sticks out a velcro paw
flighted, on the stumps and worked away through square leg
tossed up and pinged down the ground for one
pushed through flat outside off, Hales sits in the crease and picks out backward point
fullish, tight stuff around off, Root pats it back
pitched up, 132kph and driven firmly, Marsh gets his left hand to it but only diverts the ball wide of mid-off and they take one
length outside off, Hales steers it square but quickly decides against running
dug in short, Hales pulls lazily at it... and top-edges clean over Paine's head, almost goes all the way!
fired in, top of off stump, defended to the on side
tight lines, as Grandmaster Flash didn't quite sing, 133kph and Hales is happy to defend
floated up in the channel and stabbed through cover for one
full, leg-stump line, popped back to the bowler
flat and wide of the stumps, Hales rocks back and slaps one down to wide long-off
full length, maybe the googly but it barely has the chance to pitch before Root stuns it through cover point - England raise the 150, looking in good order
gets a bit of dip on this, Hales toe-ending the ball into the crease
pushed through outside off and cut for a single to the sweeper

short ball, Hales tries to wallop it over square leg... but skews a top edge to point! Think that deflected off the helmet, Australia have used his head and Marsh breaks the stand. There's pace in this deck, seemed to surprise Hales and he top-edged it straight into the badge
length, angled across from over the wicket, Morgan defends
touch short, 141kph from Marsh, who's tail is up, Morgan is cramped for room and blocks on leg stump
fuller, pushed towards the slips, defended coming forwards
shortish and chopped through point for Morgan's first run
fired in straight at 140kph and Root can only deflect it to square leg
slightly leg side, a length ball rolls away behind square off the pads
good length, 138kph and Root pushes to cover point getting on to the front foot
touch short and Root hops across to play his favoured back-foot drive through cover
angled across, Morgan walks out and drops down into the off side
length ball on off, 138kph and stroked towards mid-off, nice-looking shot but lacking placement
full and wide and clunked through the covers to the sweeper for one more
short, at the body, nudged away behind square
banged in and Root top-edges his pull, shouts of 'catch!' but it doesn't carry down to fine leg

this one carries, though - slashed over point and Stoinis takes a smart grab running in off the rope! Another low score in a poor series for the captain, he was trying to come down as Marsh dug in a 139kph delivery, Morgan off his feet as he swiped and perish in the deep
leg side, worked off the hip down to fine leg
short, 138kph outside off, Buttler drops the hands
Marsh is working the speed gun today, up at 140kph again as Buttler goes back and runs to third man
short from Hazlewood, outside off and Buttler swings and misses
back of a length in the channel, 138kph and left alone
drops back outside off and guides the ball to third man
good length, metronoming away in the channel, Root pushes square
dug in and Root pulls down to fine leg
angled in with the arm, 135kph and Buttler works a single through midwicket
banged in, good heat on this, 141kph as Buttler rolls the shoulders and turns his head away
Buttler tries to come down, another short ball and it ricochets off his shoulder behind square on the off side
length, 137kph and sliding on to the pads as the batsman glances fine
short and wide, 142kph/88mph and slashed towards third man
dug in again, another single as Root swivels on a pull
fires the ball up towards the blockhole, and block is what Buttler does
length in the channel, stabbed through the covers for one, Root has to scramble for his ground
straightens a touch, hits a leading edge... and Hazlewood does well to grab it on the bounce diving forwards in his follow through
banged in, cross seam at 136kph and it b-o-i-n-g-s over Buttler's attempted pull, Paine stretching for the take
comes across his stumps to defend
short ball and collared for four! Buttler smokes a pull in front of deep midwicket to bring England a boundary, first since the 25th over
pitched up, taking the pace off, worked back fine of mid-on for one
back of a length, arrow straight, defended back down the pitch
clipped back down the pitch, half-stopped in the followthrough
slashed out through the covers, quite high on the splice and in the air for a while

climbing into the pull and thumped under the ribcage! Ouch, that's going to hurt. No dissimilar to Pietersen's cracked rib against McGrath in the 2006-07 tour. Hopefully no lasting damage on this occasion
off line
dabbed into the off side and through they jog. Root can rest up at the non-striker's end for a moment
short, too short, over the shoulder and out stretch the umpire's arms
tapped into the off side, Root was slow getting going, and Maxwell's shy slides past the stumps! A direct hit would have been very, very tight
tossed up, smacked with lots of bottom hand into the leg side
worked into the gap at mid-on for another single
clocked into the covers
swept, picking the length early and placing it through backward square
thumped out through the leg side again
looped up and blocked to the off side
in the slot, and slotted over long-on! Power and placement
tapped into the off side, another single to the cause
tapped to cover, riding the extra bounce
back of a length, rises sharply as Root rocks back into the pull but can't time the shot. Indicates that it is a bit two-paced
swinging into the toes, and tucked behind square. A bread-and-butter single

full, and Buttler holes out to mid-off! That's a critical breakthrough for Australia, Warner back-pedals to complete the catch, and once again, Tye's slower ball draws out the miscue from a well-set batsman
back of a length, worked to leg
big stride, head over the ball
blocked into the off side
pushed into the gap at mid-on
squeezed into the off side
dancing down the pitch, looking to be aggressive, and gathered at mid-off
on the back foot, tapped into the off side
flicked off the toes, mid-on intercepts
short, aggressive, but rather harshly judged as a wide,
another short ball, perhaps Root thought that was it for the over, but it doesn't get up, and a steepling top-edge lands safe! He got out in that fashion at Adelaide ... a key let-off, perhaps
tucks the single to get off strike
full and straight, half stopped by the bowler in his followthrough but Moeen steals the single as the ball deflects to mid-off
angled defence down to third man, another single picked off
a bottom-handed biff into the covers
down on one knee, and nailed hard on the sweep, but square leg wears the shot to prevent the single
nurdled to the leg side
onto the front foot, meeting the fuller length, and steered into the covers
delicate flick over the shoulder from Root, reversing the hands to ramp-sweep the ball. Gathered with a slide by the chasing gully
dabbed out to cover
round the wicket, whipped into the leg side
on the legs, Moeen this time works the single to square leg
round the wicket, very full, attacking the base of the stumps and gathered at mid-on
a round-house pull, out to deep midwicket
down the leg side. Was there some bat or pad on that? Very tight to the body either way
flicked into the leg side, and dozy running from Moeen! Ball-watching as Smith's shy comes in from midwicket, and he'd have been gone with a direct hit
eased down the ground to keep the strike
worked into the covers
sensible nudge down to long-on
hauled out through square leg
that's a very soft dismissal from Moeen! Down the track, losing his shape, a wellied drive in the air to cover, and England's hopes of their habitual 300-plus total are looking bleak all of a sudden
worked out to the leg side
back of a length, a languid pull out to deep midwicket
full length, and defended back down the pitch
round the wicket, angled into the right hander, and blocked to the off side
banged in short, and that's cutely played, leaning back, upper-cutting through the gap at third man
stabbed defence through third man
width and slapped through third man
on the pads, nudged round the corner
forward and blocked to the off side
drifting down the leg side. But at least there is drift. Makes him a particular threat
leaning forward to defend
propping onto the front foot, good line and length
looking to attack, but Zampa has him under lock and key, no width to work with
slapped with lots of bottom hand over the covers
nudged into the leg side
short and hauled out through the leg side
pounded out to deep point
short and wide, slapped high and hard, and just eludes third man! The ball ricochets off the spreadeagled fielder and over the rope, and that is Root's fifty as well.
heaved out through backward square, Root gives it some bottom-handed heft
tapped through third man
flicked to the leg side
low full toss, clipped to midwicket and Starc does well to save four overthrows as the shy comes in
a dot-ball in the end, as Rashid gets in a tangle trying to manipulate the angles
a bottom-handed bunt inches short of long-on! Perfectly placed, in the end
nudged off the hip
run out! Stabbed to point, and just the minutest hesitation does for Rashid, as a screaming shy from point plucks out the non-striker's poles!
slower bouncer, pulled out to midwicket
short and pulled out through square leg
tucked off the pads to the leg side
back of a length, attempted glide through third man, but drops down into the crease instead
worked down to fine leg
pulled out through the leg side
tight wicket-to-wicket line, pushed back down the pitch, that's a fine containing over
another cunning slower ball, tucked to midwicket
swatted, in the air, through the leg side
bottom-handed biff to mid-on

a mow over the leg side, and another catch in the deep! And was that another Tye slower ball? Certainly looked as though Willey was through his shot early, flapping the ball much squarer than he might have intended. This is a fine collective bowling effort from Australia, and England just can't get any momentum back into their innings
flipped into the leg side
less exceptional this time, mind you...
pounded out to the leg side with a cross-batted mow
round the wicket, makes room for a swipe over the covers, and gets some decent contact
flicked out to midwicket
stand and deliver, a mighty wipe in an ambitious direction over the covers, but no contact on this occasion
exceptional batting, planted over the keeper's head with a total inversion of the stance! Nailed it
dancing at the crease again, but no effective contact this time
short, pulled down into the leg side, Root scampers, and just beats the shy as it comes in from midwicket
smashed high and hard, but not high enough! In the slot once again, Root got underneath his shot, much like Roy before him, and picks out the man right back on the fence
slapped into the leg side
well bowled, beats the edge with good carry through to the keeper
well bowled! And that is five for Tye! Yorker, straight and true, rattles the timbers, and England's innings has come to an ignominious end
swing for Willey... although it starts wide of off and goes further, causing the umpire to signal wide
shifts his line across, 132kph and curving away nicely as Warner watches it through
angled in and straightening, stabbed towards point from the crease
good length, shaping in and then out in the channel at 134kph/82mph, Warner shoulders arms
this swings early, slightly short in length and dabbed through backward point from back in the crease for the first run of the reply
curling away in the channel, an encouraging start for Willey, left alone
full, swinging and clubbed to the rope! Head reaches out and batters Willey through the covers for the first four of the day, to beery cheers around the Perth Stadium... So much for encouragement
over the wicket, pitched up a touch too straight, 136kph and helped off the pads past mid-on for a couple
full outside off, shaping in a fraction but Warner just bullies it on the up, crunched past the dive at cover point for a couple
strays on to the pads, Warner flicks at it and the ball diverts wide of Buttler, no bat involved

short and wide, slashed and he gets a thick edge - but Bairstow drops it at first slip! A dolly drop and Head gets a life, he was maybe distracted by Buttler moving across to his left but still should have held it
comes across and taps the ball away
full and punched towards mid-off
heaved over mid-off, Warner is away... Bit of width and he climbs into a lofted drive, bounces a few yards short of the rope
ah, good come back, swings it and finds the leading edge, falls short of cover
touch too straight and worked for one
gets a bit square on and taps it away
good length around off stump and Head shows it a straight bat
short and hammered on the cut but picks out backward point, who stops it smartly
drops short and POW, roundhoused through midwicket! Dismissive power from Warner, picks up four more

oh, slips under the bat, Warner's been castled! Curran gets it right up on the toes and Warner is done, maybe yorking himself with a lack of footwork, a poor series finishes on a low note... Out comes the Aeroplanino celebration from Curran, England have their first wicket
down the leg side, there's a sound as it passes, Buttler takes the catch... flicked the pad
length ball outside off, Stoinis gets into line and lets it go
fuller, 135kph on off stump, punched to mid-off
pitched up and again Stoinis come across and leaves
angled in, sliding on to the pads, Head flicks fine for a couple
again Willey gets a bit too straight and the ball doesn't swing, Head flicks a couple more
full, Head unfurls a powerful on-drive but sends it to the man on the edge of the ring
pitched up on off, middled on the drive to mid-off
pitched up, 135kph cross seam now, giving up on swing and again it's drilled to mid-off
tight lines, Head punches on the up but it rolls to mid-on this time and there's no run
Curran plugs away outside off, Stoinis continues to <del>pretend to be a proper batsman</del> leave
digs in the bouncer, think it maybe clipped the shoulder as he shrugged it off
fullish and defended on the stumps
pitched up but this is a half-volley on the pads and Stoinis opens his account with a wristy whack through square leg
fired in straight and tapped back
short, 129kph outside off, rocks on to the pull but sends it skimming straight to midwicket
short and wide from Willey and this is twocked into the ground past a leaping backward point, wide of third man for a couple
full, outside off and Head lays into a drive but it's well stopped at cover
full again, sliding in straight and flicked square
pitched up straight and worked off the pads for a couple through midwicket
banged in, Stoinis swivels on the pull but picks out the man on the ring
oof, he's hit that, full in the slot to drive, Stoinis steps out and fair dinkums it straight back past mid-off for four!
slanted across, nice and full and plunked to mid-off coming forwards
length ball, slightly wide and Head flays an angled bat for one into the covers
mistimed, maybe a slower delivery from Curran, driven uppishly but short of mid-off
this was definitely slower, out the back of the hand... but dispatched at full speed back down the ground, a flat mow that almost goes all the way at long-on!
good length and worked into the leg side
puts it on a length, chopped into the covers
starts nicely, sliding on to hit the outside edge but it runs wide of slip for a couple
tossed up and pushed down the track
pushed through a little too straight, Stoinis sweeps and sends it fizzing away to deep backward square leg - raising the Australia 50 in the process
pushed through outside off and he nearly gets in a tangle trying to sweep again
floated up and defended coming forwards
oh, that's a whopper! Stoinis goes downtown for some hang time! Skips to the pitch and absolutely wallops the ball into the second tier of the stand... Perth Stadium's biggest hit to date
on the pads and clipped through square leg
good line from Curran, gets this to straighten a touch as Stoinis pushes at it and is beaten
fuller, played with a straight bat into the covers
length, maybe taking the pace off, Stoinis goes across and tries to flick to leg, gets a leading edge
banged in, 131kph and pulled through square leg for a single
strays on to the pads and clipped for a couple
floated up and pulled aggressively but straight to midwicket
full and flighted, crunched through the covers, more power from Stoin Cold Stoinis!
teasing, tossed up and spinning through
comes forward and pushes this down the ground
flat and angled across outside off, Head rocks back to crunch the ball to mid-off
flung up outside off, spinning away as Stoinis drops back and cuts a couple through cover point
full outside off and driven firmly to mid-off
length, 139kph from Ball, dropped softly into the off side and they hustle through as Roy comes in for a shy at the non-striker's end
round the wicket, good wheels as he pushes up to 143kph and Head swings at it in vain
back of a length over off stump, Head pulls and gets a thick bottom edge, Buttler does well to stop it scooting past him
shortish, rising outside off, fended away off the back foot... and it races away fine of third man for four, bringing up the fifty stand
angled in back of a length, 142kph and pulled this time, just one through midwicket
dragged down but Head swats it straight back to the bowler
tossed up, uses the feet and works one through midwicket
looped up on off stump, flicked to midwicket
tossed up nice and slow, Stoinis comes down but picks out midwicket again
pushed through, driven and it comes off the inside half of the bat
tossed up on the stumps, Stoinis goes deep in the crease and clips one in front of square on the leg side
full outside off, Stoinis climbs into drive but sends it along the carpet to mid-off
all the way over third man! Short and wide and he frees the arms, uses the pace and dumps it beyond the ropes
short of a length, defended on off
ooh, close to the outside edge, 142kph in the corridor and Stoinis nearly pays for a flat-footed flirt
short and wide but he's off balance trying to hammer a cut and again fails to connect

knocked into the covers, called through for a tight single, there's a direct hit and this could be tight... although they then try to pinch a second on the ricochet. It goes up to the third umpire and Head is struggling here, there's only a frame or two in it, but he's not managed to get his bat over the line - this is going to be out! Morgan was the fielder, he pretty much hit the bails with a sharp throw
flighted, Stoinis stands tall and pushes down the ground to long-on

nicely bowled, draws him forward and Buttler whips off the bails, has he been stumped first ball?! England seem fairly confident, Smith was off balance reaching forwards, but it looks like he had some boot behind the line... Yes, Dharmasena takes several looks at it, but Smith is okay
flighted, the googly, I think, hits the splice and rolls in the leg side, Stoinis has to scramble back for his ground
tosses up another Bosie and Smith defends from the crease
floated full around off stump, punched into the covers
flighted, dipping on off and driven firmly but straight to cover
comes across and defends on off stump
fullish, angled in and played back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, Stoinis waits in the crease and drops the ball down behind square for one
fired in straight, blocked back to the bowler
pitched up and driven, off the outer half of the bat down to third man
on the stumps, 140kph and Stoinis is happy to defend
down the track, whipped supremely out through deep midwicket, and gathered just inside the rope
googly to resume, tight to off stump and stoutly defended
sliding down the leg side, tucked out to square leg to spare Rashid a wide
wafted out to long-on with a big stride
worked into the covers
onto the front foot, calmly pressed to short cover
leaning forward and dabbed to point
outside off, nurdled down to third man
opens the face and glides down to third man once again
banged in short, gets up sharply, but there's no reaching that one
full length, attacking the base of the stumps, fended away
up on the toes, attempted glide through third man
wider on the crease, angled into the stumps, good restrictive delivery
tossed up and drilled into the covers
finds the gap this time
tucked into the leg side and Stoinis gallops through for a fine fifty
worked into the gap at long-on
driven into the covers once again
eased out to cover. Rashid doing a good job of putting a handbrake on these middle overs
tossed up, on the toes, tapped down to long-on
poked out to cover
short midwicket intercepts
worked out to the leg side, still content to deal in singles
full length and worked down the ground once more
flipped into the leg side, a servicably restrictive over
finds the gap in the covers once more
back of a length and drilled back at the bowler
shorter, wider, a rare loose one, and slammed to the point fence. No missing out there!
here we go! This is getting lively again, pounded high and handsome over long-on, picking the wrong'un, and the wrong'un gets picked out of the stands!
faster and flatter outside off, misses out on the cut
nudged to short midwicket
twirled onto a good length outside off, worked to mid-on
back of a length, punched up to long-on
stretching forward, eased into the covers
beaten and stumped! Moeen slides one past Smith's edge, he played for the turn but it went straight on, and another non-descript innings from the skipper comes to a tame end!
on the back foot, punched up to mid-on
bashed out to deep cover
punched into the covers
thumped down the ground, in the slot and met with a free-wheeling blade. Top boshing
cracked into the covers, up on the toes
sliding onto leg stump, worked square
looped up, pushed to cover
squeezed back to the bowler from a full length
tossed up outside off, and slapped hard through gully. Came largely off a thick edge, but the outfield is rapid and there's no cutting that off
leaning forward to defend
standing tall on the back foot, and punched to mid-on
wafted through the off side with a roll of the wrists

what a stunning catch! Absolutely panned back down the pitch, high to Moeen's right, but he sticks out a mitt, and the ball sticks between thumb and forefinger! The umpire has hit the deck, and Moeen looks as startled as the batsman that that has not sizzled to the boundary!
looped up, deflected into the off side.
wide on the crease, full length, defended to cover
nipping off the deck, back into the right hander. Good ball, Ball
outside off, an attempted slash through the off side,  but no contact this time
full again, met with a measured drive to mid-off
shorter, and slapped uppishly into no-man's land at deep midwicket
on the back foot, defended into the covers, that's a decent over to bring us to the halfway mark with the game very much in the balance
on the back foot, and clipped to the leg side
striding onto the front foot
width, and cracked into the covers
reverses the hands, dabbed gently into the gap behind square on the off side
more flight, teasing length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
tight line, nudged into the leg side off the front foot
steps across the stumps to guide a drive into the covers
full length, pumped into the deep, where Moeen swoops with one hand in an attempt to hurry the second run and gives away the boundary instead! Whoops
stands tall in defence, and pushed back down the pitch
up on the toes to deep cover, and huge ironic cheers as Moeen gathers properly this time and sends in the return
on the back foot, good lift off the deck, defended back to the bowler
hopping across the stumps and tucked into the leg side
on the back foot, pinged hard back to the bowler who gathers on his knees
tight line on middle and off, Stoinis goes back and across to defend
tidy line and length again, nothing for the batsman to work with
slightly leg-sided, and urgently flicked into the gap behind square. Good running
plants the front foot, and that's up, up and away! Tossed up, tempting the aggression, but expertly executed
on the toes, whipped to leg
extra nip off the deck, thuds into the thigh pad
blocked back down the pitch
oh, well played, banged in short, Maxwell unfurls the ramp and Buttler can't haul that one in
tapped into the covers to keep the scoreboard moving
back of a length, dabbed down into the crease
attempted pull out through the leg side
looped onto the toes, tapped out to midwicket
reverses the hands, nearly beaten by a good bit of tight bowling from Moeen, but gets enough bat to draw a tumbling stop from Rashid at backward point
dabbed into the off side
tossed up, nurdled down to long on
outside off, slashed out to deep point
gathered at backward square leg
well bowled, tight line from round the wicket, drawing a solid back-foot block
on the hips, whipped behind square
on the back foot, and defended back down the pitch
sliding past the leg stump
tight  line and defended
a fierce yorker, excellent pace and nearly squeezes through
opens the face, guides a single down to third man
tossed up outside off, flat-batted back to the bowler
up and over... and over the head of long-off! It teased the man on the rope, but just kept on going!
thrashed back at the bowler, who gathers in his followthrough
dragged out to deep midwicket
turning into the toes, tucked to midwicket
looped up again, a good tight finish but Australia made some good dents in that over
angled into the toes, flicked to the leg side
full length, stabbed into the covers and gathered with a slide
full length again, dug out into the leg side for another jogged single. Australia milking it nicely at the moment
width, and cut down to third man
tapped out to point
up comes the fifty stand with another chiselled single, and that will also be drinks
floated up on off, Stoinis is down early to sweep through square
pushed through, Maxwell opens the face and steers towards point
tossed up, slow legbreak which Maxwell dabs down but again it's too tight for one
outrageous! Reverse-swatted over backward point for four! A crazy golf shot, chipped over the infield and it bounces away, no one out there so a safe option
flighted, worked into the leg side for one

full toss, slugged to long-on - no hundred for Stoinis! He goes for 87, unlucky for this Aussie... he skipped out and smashed it flat down the ground but didn't get it as high as he needed and Tom Curran raced in to take an excellent diving catch
fired in full, hitting the pads as Maxwell hangs back on leg stump
length on the stumps, tapped away
Willey is bowling round the wicket, fired in around the line of off, defended square
full, 132kph and Maxwell is cramped again, misses with a flick and it rolls away off the pads
angled in with the arm, worked to the on side
low full toss, bunted towards cover - and that's a maiden for Willey
floats up the googly, slips inside the bat to hit the front pad
flighted, slow and loopy and Paine drive, just gets it past Rashid diving to his right
full on off, Maxwell drives to extra cover
dragged down and Maxwell nearly comes a cropper, pancake-flipped to leg but it comes off the toe of the bat and loops much squarer than intended, Morgan can't quite get there from midwicket
lobbed up straight and tucked to leg
pushed through, Paine taps into the covers - four dots in the over
130kph, sliding down the leg side first up

rapped on the pads, nibbling in sharply... Buttler is appealing desperately for lbw and England decide to review; did Maxwell hit it? No, this has pinned him on the back leg, right in front middle and leg! The decision is overturned, Maxwell has failed to stay and see it through... Bit of a frantic swipe, although it was well bowled, jagging past the bat
lets go a full toss, Starc bunts it back to the bowler

angled across, nips late and takes the edge - Buttler swallows it going low to his left! Curran leaps to punch the air, brilliant bit of bowling and a catch to match! He was trying to tuck to leg when he needed to play straight, Starc heads off with Daddles for company and Australia are seven down, the chase getting trickier and trickier
pitched up and driven, gets a chunk of inside edge on it and the ball races away for four! Meaty swing and it outruns mid-on
length outside off, Tye hammers into the deep, just one as the cover sweeper gives chase
length, shaping away at 135kph - looks like Curran is reversing it - and Paine leaves alone
length ball, spinning in and tapped away hanging back on leg stump
lobbed up, clubbed down the ground for one to long-on
darted in the stumps, Paine jabs to midwicket
pushed through on the stumps and again Paine can't get it past the man on the leg side
flat on the stumps, Paine backs away to cut but sends a thick edge to backward point
wicket-to-wicket, fired in and punched back to the bowler - just one off the over
fullish around off stump, slower delivery but Tye doesn't fall into the trap, defended solidly
pitched up and shaping in, 134kph and Tye crunches it along the ground to mid-on
dug in short, he rocks back to try and cut but fails to lay bat on it - possibly too close for the shot

dropped! Hoicked leg side, Tye goes after the slower ball and he sends it high towards deep square leg, Bairstow is usually a good man to have under one of these but he's already shelled a catch today and can't hold on diving forwards! Looks like he overran it slightly
oof, beats the bat, rising off a length as Tye hangs back

pitched up, goes for the yorker, Tye shuffles across and deflects it fine... Curran appeals for lbw but the umpire turns him down again. England don't review this time, must have been heading down leg
pushed through, Paine tries to reverse-paddle this with the back of the bat, misses and it deflects away off Buttler's gloves

takes the leading edge, snapped up at cover! England have another, this is turning into a full-blown collapse! Tye misjudges this on the back foot, working across the line and it's a simple catch for Morgan
flighted, Zampa comes across and dabs into the covers for one to get going
pushed through and worked down to the leg side
flat on the stumps, Paine is on one knee and laps it over his shoulder, using the pace and gets it towards fine leg for a couple
tossed up and worked into a gap for one more
nipbacker on a length, hit on the back pad and again Curran gets no joy from Simon Fry... England don't review, maybe a touch high? He was coming down the pitch and struck above the knee
length ball, Paine pokes into a gap in the covers
good length around off, defended
fuller, leg side and it thuds into the pads as Zampa hangs back
short ball, shovelled around the corner towards fine leg
full outside off, 135kph and driven in front of mid-off for one
pushed through outside off and sliced off the back foot towards point
pushed through and tucked to the leg side, Zampa sets off before being sent back, Morgan swoops on it but he makes his ground!
touch short and Paine cuts firmly, behind the man in the deep and they get a couple
dropped! Paine tried to hit out and plopped it down the ground towards long-on, where Hales grasses a low chance! You expect those to be taken... Paine survives, could be crucial
angled in and nudged down the ground to Hales, gets a cheer for fielding
short, swatted down to long-on again... It's following Hales
round the wicket, full around off and driven to cover
pitched up, gets this away behind point into a gap for two
length ball, 134kph outside off, Paine reaches for it and thick-edges one to third man
fires in the attempted yorker, Zampa digs it out on to his front foot
full length, 132kph and dinked through the covers for one
fired in on off, looking for reverse swing, defended back to the bowler
short of a length and chopped into the covers as Zampa hangs back
slower ball, pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket
length, cutting his fingers over it again, Paine runs one to third man
width and slashed towards third man, where Moeen is wrong-footed by the spin and it skips for four! Poor fielding and it gifts a vital boundary to the Australia cause
fullish and driven aerilly through the covers
back of a length over the stumps, Paine turns it around the corner, looking for two to deep backward square - but they settle for the single, Paine keeping the strike
round the wicket, pitched up on off and Paine blocks
tight stuff from Willey, 132kph on middle and off and tapped to the leg side
fired in, 138kph and again there's no width to play with, Paine pushes into the covers
short of a length, rising up on to the hip for Paine to tuck one square

over the wicket, full and straight, hit on the toe - given! Zampa calls for the review, as he has to... Just a matter of where it pitched, from the looks of it, maybe a touch leg side... Yes, pitched outside leg, so the decision is overturned! Cheers of relief around the ground, Zampa survives!
full outside off, chopped into the covers - another dot, Willey denied a wicket but he dries up the runs
short ball, taking the pace off, Paine pulls it around the corner for one
good length on off, Zampa pushes circumspectly to extra cover
banged in, Zampa heaves down the ground, in the air but it won't carry to long-on running in
dug in and smashed to the boundary! Slower-ball bouncer from Ball but it sits up invitingly and Paine swivels to slam it through deep backward square leg and perk up the crowd once more!
angled in and dabbed to the leg side for the single
hits a length, Zampa shows it straight bat
slower ball, on middle and leg, Paine tries to work across the line but only pops it back down the track off the splice
outside off, again taking the pace off, runs this down to third man
bowled 'im! Woolly swing of the bat and Curran knocks back middle stump! Silence washes over the Perth Stadium, Zampa's gutsy knock is ended and England are one wicket away
round the wicket, swerving away from back of a length, play and a miss
fuller, poked square and they won't chance a single to point
back-of-the-hand slower ball, wide of the stumps, Hazlewood prods and misses
slower-ball bouncer again, Paine hammers a pull to deep square leg... and declines the single
Paine backs away to leg, Ball fires in a cutter, gets a play-and-miss as Buttler tumbles to gather
short, taking the pace off, Paine swings hard and thick-edges four to third man! Came off the toe, in fact, and scuttles fine past the man down there
full and straight - RAMPED FOR SIX!!! What a shot, skill and guts from Paine! Ball missed the yorker and he got the lap away perfectly to sail all the way over the rope at fine leg!
dug on short, Paine pulls square and again declines one
finishes with another slow bouncer, pulled to fine leg for one to keep Paine on strike
full, fast, swerving in and dug out on off stump into the covers - dot ball

hits the stumps! Curran wins it for England! Paine's heroics in vain, beaten by reverse swing to rattle leg stump - Curran claims a maiden international five-for with the final ball! What a finish, a cracking match to christen the new Perth Stadium
